content:
Would it be possible to have the FME's operation table check available as a Python module or API? (it'd take the operation table as an argument (in different formats), and return a json with "equation_number": 1 (for satisfied) or 0 for (refuted))?
I made a small RL agent exploring the param space, but I hope I can build it on top of that tool (I've been using it a lot, and it seems to be very reliable).

@Shreyas Srinivas Please take a look at this. I'll be running an rl agent. We could be experimenting with reward functions and all that.
What I've noticed is that compute is a very strong limitation for lots of people (I've been a running a lot of ATP experiments in the last couple of days), and that new methods might be needed.
Wrote the script myself. Not as a package - just as a function in a script. So this is solved for me.
Michael Bucko has marked this topic as resolved.
Nice. Is there a PR for this?
Tagged you in that ticket. No PR atm. Just running the script. Shared it too in that script. Still needs to make sure that it's running correctly.
(The script is currently only for my special case - 854N413)
